ErrorHolder<E extends Exception> - Interface in zyu19.libs.action.chain.config
ActionChain will provide instances of this type through 'NiceConsumer<ErrorHolder>' when an error occurred, to inform the user whether the error may be recoverable.

F

fail(NiceConsumer<ErrorHolder>) - Method in class zyu19.libs.action.chain.AbstractActionChain
 
fail(Class<T>, NiceConsumer<ErrorHolder<T>>) - Method in class zyu19.libs.action.chain.AbstractActionChain
 
fail(NiceConsumer<ErrorHolder>) - Method in interface zyu19.libs.action.chain.config.ChainStyle
set the onFailure callback for 'PureAction' objects added subsequently
Note: uncaught exceptions will be ignored so that it will not crash your app.
fail(Class<T>, NiceConsumer<ErrorHolder<T>>) - Method in interface zyu19.libs.action.chain.config.ChainStyle
set the onFailure callback for 'PureAction' objects added subsequently Adding additional fail with class constraints will not wipe out your previous default failure handler, but the original handler will not be called if the specified exception was caught by this new onFailure handler.

use(ChainEditor) - Method in class zyu19.libs.action.chain.ActionChain
Deprecated.
Use of this function is now discouraged.
The editor of the chain might change the default exception handler, and has to change the i/o flow among current chain's PureActions.
These problems can be avoid by returning a new ActionChain inside a PureAction. This works exactly the same as the way a Promise wait for another promise if that second promise was returned inside the first promise's actions.
